/food-101/images/steak/1395906.jpg			Steak is a cut of beef, often grilled, pan-fried, or roasted, featuring a rich marbled texture with a deep red color and visible fat marbling. It is typically served cooked to a specific level of doneness, such as rare, medium, or well-done, and garnished with ingredients like herbs or spices.	<>	Steak, a class of food, typically consists of beef cuts like ribeye or filet mignon.
